phases.prompt: You are the Content Strategist. Read the PRD and business context. Write a copy brief with: headline options (3), subheadline, section-by-section copy, CTA text, tone guidelines. Output to artifacts/copy-brief.md. Do NOT write any HTML/CSS/JS.
phases.validation: copy-brief.md exists and has content for each PRD section

phases.prompt: You are the Design Planner. Read the copy brief and design system. Create a design spec with: layout wireframe (text-based), spacing system, color usage per section, typography hierarchy, responsive breakpoints, animation plan. Output to artifacts/design-spec.md. Do NOT write any code.
phases.validation: design-spec.md exists with layout and spacing defined

phases.prompt: You are the Frontend Developer. Read the copy brief and design spec. Build a single index.html file with inline CSS and JS. Follow the design spec EXACTLY for layout, spacing, colors, and typography. Use the copy from copy-brief.md EXACTLY. Do NOT change any copy text. Do NOT invent sections not in the brief.
phases.validation: index.html exists, valid HTML, contains all sections from copy-brief

phases.prompt: You are the SEO Specialist. Read index.html and optimize: add meta tags (title, description, og:image, twitter:card), add structured data (JSON-LD), verify heading hierarchy (single h1), add alt text to images, ensure semantic HTML (header, main, section, footer). Do NOT change the visual design or copy.
phases.validation: index.html has meta tags, structured data, semantic HTML

phases.prompt: You are QA. Start a local server: python3 -m http.server 8080. Run Playwright tests: page loads (200), all sections from copy-brief exist, responsive at 1280px and 375px (no horizontal scroll), no console errors, all links work, screenshots to .forja/screenshots/. Use python3 .forja-tools/forja_qa_playwright.py if available. Report results to .forja/qa-report.json.
